intro: Trigonostemon tomentellus, commonly known as the woolly trigonostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces capsules as fruit. Trigonostemon tomentellus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
